trends: There have been no other sightings in Marblehead
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: Sighting DetailsOn July 3rd 2009 I was staying with a friend's family on Lake Erie. I was inside getting something to eat when everyone on the patio started yelling for me to come outside. (I have a science background and work in a related field) I ran outside to see a bright red fireball coming from the nortwest horizon and moving southeast. Following the fireball was a second fireball approximately 4 seconds behind. We (8 witnesses) followed the path as long at it stayed in site (approx. 20-30 seconds) The object was very bright but it's altitude and speed were very difficult to gauge. At 10:12pm a third red fireball moved across the sky, slightly less bright and further away than the previous two. It came from a direction further west than the first two. These objects did not streak across the sky and appeared to be burning or shooting flames. My first thought when I saw the objects was that we were witnessing missiles being launched. As I watched these objects I kept hoping they would continue to move across the sky and not crash to the earth. The first two objects disappeared behind the houses and the third one behind a cloud.
